page.title: 03BOWER HALL FARM,WEST MERSEA.
page.content: Midway between West Mersea and East Mersea is{Bower Hall Farm.}The owners of the farm are{Mr and Mrs Jowers}but their son manages and looks after it with two helpers,one of whom is his wife.Mr Jowers(the younger one)makes some of his money by growing crops like{wheat}and{barley,}but most of the land is down to grass on which he grazes his{cows.}He keeps chickens, {ducks}(which live in his large pond)and{pigs}which he now makes most of his money on.He feeds his pigs on ground barley and wheat.When he first gets a sow,he feeds it on five pounds of this mixture per day.When a sow is "in pig"(expecting piglets)it is fed on ten pounds a day,and once the sow has got a litter,Mr Jowers will just feed when necessary.When his pigs weigh 50 kilogrammes or over,they will go to market,as you need a licence to
